entry.title: Useful bitcoin patches...
entry.summary: In a discussion about potential improvements to Bitcoin, Christian Decker suggests that multithreading the RPC and adding Keep-Alive would benefit everyone. However, there may be race conditions in the code that need to be addressed through testing before implementing these changes. Another proposal is the 'hub mode' which would optimize connection logic for all nodes by default, but this idea is met with criticism from others who argue that it could lead to DDOS attacks. They suggest that instead, miners concerned with fast block propagation should manually add other miners as nodes, and that the addnode logic should be fixed to reserve connection slots for addnoded nodes. While there are longer-term improvements that could be made to connection and forwarding logic, it is difficult to test and validate these changes.
